name: Cognitive Reframing
description: Consciously identify a negative interpretation of an event and actively generate a more neutral or positive alternative interpretation.

name: Radio Doom and Gloom
description: Treat the mind as a radio playing a background track of negativity while you focus on other tasks.

name: Diaphragmatic Breathing
description: Breathe deeply into the belly (not the chest) to signal safety to the nervous system.

name: Color Your Mood
description: Assign colors to emotions and fill a body outline to map where feelings live.

name: Future Pull
description: Vividly imagine a preferred future to generate present-moment motivation.

name: 4-7-8 Breathing for Sleep
description: Use the 4-7-8 breathing pattern specifically to lower heart rate at bedtime.

name: Balanced Predictions
description: Write down the worst-case scenario, the best-case scenario, and the most likely scenario to combat fortune-telling.

name: Externalizing the Problem
description: Refer to the problem as an entity (e.g., "The Depression" or "The Anger") rather than a trait ("I am angry").

name: Letter Writing
description: Write a letter to the problem (e.g., "Dear Anxiety, I am breaking up with you...").

name: Checking for Polarization
description: Identify two parts in conflict (e.g., one wants to work, one wants to sleep) and mediate between them.

name: Replacing "What If" with "Then What"
description: Shift from ruminating on a potential disaster to planning specific coping steps if the event actually occurred.

name: ABC Functional Analysis
description: Analyze the Antecedent (trigger), Behavior (reaction), and Consequence (outcome) to understand the function of a habit.

name: Bedtime Buffer Zone
description: Create a 60-minute wind-down period with no screens and low light before bed.

name: Expansion
description: Breathe into and make room for a difficult feeling in the body, rather than contracting around it.

name: The Best Possible Self
description: Write a narrative about a future where everything has gone as well as possible.

name: Resource Activation
description: Explicitly list external and internal resources available to solve the current crisis.

name: The 6 Fs
description: Find, Focus, Flesh out, Feel toward, Befriend, and check for Fears to get to know a part.

name: The Miracle Question
description: Ask "If a miracle solved your problem tonight while you slept, what would be the first thing you noticed differently tomorrow?" to identify goals.

name: Self-to-Part Dialogue
description: Journal a conversation between the "Self" and a specific part.

name: Repetition (Milk, Milk, Milk)
description: Repeat a difficult word or thought until it loses its meaning and becomes just a sound.

name: Deconstruction of Truths
description: Examine societal "truths" (e.g., "Men must be strong") to see if they serve the client's narrative.

name: Three Good Things
description: List three things that went well today and why they happened to build self-efficacy.

name: IMPROVE: Encouragement
description: Cheerlead yourself with statements like "I can stand this" or "This will pass".

name: TIPP: Temperature
description: Submerge the face in cold water (or use an ice pack) for 30 seconds to trigger the Mammalian Dive Reflex and slow the heart rate.

name: Accumulating Positive Emotions
description: Build a "life worth living" by engaging in positive events daily to buffer against stress.

name: Cognitive Pie Chart
description: Create a pie chart to allocate responsibility for an event, reducing the tendency to assume 100% personal blame.

name: Sleep Restriction
description: Temporarily limit time in bed to match actual sleep time (e.g., 6 hours) to build high sleep pressure and efficiency.

name: Mindfulness of Current Emotions
description: Observe the emotion as a wave, noting its rise and fall without blocking or amplifying it.

name: Mastery and Pleasure Ratings
description: Rate daily activities on a scale of 0â€“10 for "Mastery" (sense of accomplishment) and "Pleasure" to identify energy sources.

name: Mapping the Influence
description: Explore how the problem impacts the person's life and how the person impacts the problem's life.

name: Cost Benefit Analysis
description: Systematically evaluate the costs and benefits of a target behavior vs. an alternative behavior.

name: Graded Exposure Hierarchy
description: List feared situations from least to most anxiety-provoking and systematically expose yourself to them.

name: The "Voo" Sound
description: Inhale deeply and make a low, vibrating "Voo" sound on the exhale to stimulate the vagus nerve in the chest and belly.

name: RESISTT
description: Reframe, Engage, Someone else, Intense sensations, Shut it out, Think neutral, Take a break.

name: Mandala Drawing
description: Draw and color inside a circle to induce a meditative state and contain chaotic emotions.

name: IMPROVE: Vacation
description: Take a brief break from adulthood responsibilities (e.g., hide under the covers for 10 minutes).

name: Problem Solving
description: Identify the specific problem causing distress and implement a solution rather than regulating the emotion.

name: Gargling
description: Gargle water aggressively to stimulate the pharyngeal muscles connected to the vagus nerve.

name: The Unwelcome Party Guest
description: Treat anxiety like an obnoxious guest at a party you are hosting; you don't have to like them, but you don't have to kick them out to enjoy the party.

name: Walking in Nature (Forest Bathing)
description: Walk slowly in a green environment to lower cortisol and engage soft fascination.

name: Externalization of Voices
description: Give the negative thought pattern a persona or name to separate it from your core identity.

name: Gratitude Journaling
description: Write down 3-5 things you are grateful for daily to retrain the brain's negativity bias.

name: Cost-Benefit Analysis of Worry
description: List the advantages and disadvantages of holding onto a specific worry to determine if it serves a protective function.

name: DEAR MAN
description: Describe facts, Express feelings, Assert wishes, Reinforce others, Stay Mindful, Appear confident, Negotiate.

name: 4-7-8 Breathing
description: Inhale for 4, hold for 7, exhale audibly for 8 to enforce a long exhalation that triggers relaxation.

name: ACCEPTS: Sensations
description: Hold an ice cube or squeeze a rubber ball to ground yourself with intense physical sensation.

name: The Path Exercise
description: Visualize walking down a path and asking parts to wait behind, allowing the Self to emerge.

name: Progressive Muscle Relaxation (PMR)
description: Tense and release muscles from toe to head to physically induce relaxation in bed.

name: Daily Parts Check-in
description: Spend 5 minutes daily asking "Who is here?" and "What do you need?" to your internal system.

name: Smallest Difference
description: Identify the smallest possible change that would indicate progress.

name: The "Not-Knowing" Stance
description: The therapist adopts a posture of curiosity rather than expertise to empower the client.

name: Identifying Cognitive Distortions
description: Label thoughts with specific distortion names (e.g., "This is all-or-nothing thinking") to reduce their subjective authority.

name: Response Prevention
description: Deliberately expose yourself to a trigger (e.g., dirt) and refuse to engage in the compulsive safety behavior (e.g., washing).

name: Grounding (5-4-3-2-1)
description: Identify 5 things you see, 4 feel, 3 hear, 2 smell, 1 taste to engage the prefrontal cortex.

name: Willing Hands
description: Turn palms upward and open the hands to embody an attitude of acceptance and non-aggression.

name: Yawning
description: Intentionally yawn repeatedly to activate the vagus nerve and cool the brain.

name: ACCEPTS: Activities
description: Distract from distress by engaging in a neutral activity like cleaning or a hobby.

name: The Choice Point
description: Map out a situation to identify "Towards moves" (acting on values) versus "Away moves" (avoiding discomfort).

name: PLEASE Skill
description: Treat Physical illness, balance Eating, avoid Altering drugs, Sleep well, Exercise to reduce vulnerability.

name: Labeling Thoughts
description: Categorize thoughts as they arise (e.g., "Thinking," "Judging," "Planning") to reduce engagement.

name: Committed Action Goals
description: Set small, value-driven goals that are achievable regardless of your emotional state.

name: Opposite Action
description: Identify the urge associated with an emotion (e.g., fear = avoid) and do the exact opposite (e.g., approach).

name: Interoceptive Exposure
description: Intentionally induce physical sensations of panic (e.g., spinning, running in place) to learn they are not dangerous.

name: Humming or Chanting "Om"
description: Hum or chant to create vibration in the vocal cords, which stimulates the vagus nerve.

name: Defining Terms
description: Ask for specific definitions of labeled terms (e.g., "What exactly does it mean to be a 'failure'?") to expose the vagueness of self-criticism.

name: Timeline Construction
description: Create a timeline of life events to gain perspective on the duration and transience of problems.

name: The Tree of Life
description: Draw a tree representing roots (history), trunk (skills), branches (hopes), and leaves (people) to consolidate identity.

name: Cognitive Shuffling
description: Visualize random, unrelated objects (e.g., "cow," "bread," "star") to interrupt ruminative thought loops and induce sleep onset.

name: IMPROVE: Imagery
description: Visualize a safe, relaxing scene or a "mental vacation" to escape current stress.

name: Parts Mapping
description: Draw a diagram of your internal system to visualize relationships and conflicts between parts.

name: Compliments
description: The therapist validates specific strengths and successes noticed during the session to reinforce agency.

name: ACCEPTS: Contributing
description: Do something kind for another person to shift focus away from self-centric distress.

name: ACCEPTS: Thoughts
description: Engage the mind in a demanding task like counting backward from 100 by 7s.

name: Titration
description: Process traumatic material in tiny, manageable "drops" rather than flooding the system.

name: Heel Drops
description: Rise on toes and drop heels firmly to the floor to discharge tension and ground through the skeletal system.

name: Updating the Part
description: Inform a part that the client is no longer a child and has adult resources now.

name: Role Playing
description: Rehearse a difficult conversation or situation in a safe environment to build confidence and skills.

name: Socratic Questioning
description: Use disciplined questioning to challenge assumptions, such as "What is the evidence for this thought?" and "Is there an alternative explanation?".

name: TIPP: Intense Exercise
description: Engage in short bursts of high-intensity cardio (e.g., jumping jacks) to burn off acute emotional arousal.

name: Continuum Technique
description: Place a feared characteristic (e.g., "incompetence") on a continuum from 0-100% to see where one truly falls, avoiding binary labeling.

name: Random Acts of Kindness
description: Perform small, anonymous favors to boost oxytocin and social connection.

name: Self-Soothe (5 Senses)
description: Consciously comfort yourself using vision, hearing, smell, taste, and touch (e.g., lighting a scented candle).

name: Pros and Cons List
description: Analyze the consequences of tolerating distress versus acting on an impulsive urge.

name: Palm Cupping for Eyes
description: Place warm palms over closed eyes to reduce visual stimulation and soothe the nervous system.

name: Passengers on the Bus
description: Imagine yourself as the driver of a bus and your thoughts as noisy passengers; keep driving your route regardless of what they shout.

name: Pursed Lip Breathing
description: Inhale through the nose and exhale slowly through pursed lips (like blowing a candle) to slow respiration.

name: Thanking Your Mind
description: Respond to unhelpful thoughts with "Thank you, Mind, for that interesting story".

name: Clay Sculpting
description: Smash, smooth, or mold clay to express anger or reconstruct a sense of self.

name: The Self-Hug
description: Wrap arms around the chest and squeeze firmly to provide containment and proprioceptive feedback.

name: Decatastrophizing
description: Ask "What is the worst that could happen, and if it did, how would I cope?" to reduce the perceived magnitude of a feared event.

name: Neck Rotation (The Basic Exercise)
description: Interlace fingers behind the head, look to the right with eyes only (keeping head still) until you yawn, sigh, or swallow.

name: The "Best Friend" Technique
description: Ask, "What would I say to my best friend if they were in this situation?" to foster self-compassion and objectivity.

name: Half-Smile
description: Relax the facial muscles and adopt a serene, slight smile to send feedback to the brain to regulate emotion.

name: Do Something Different
description: If a current solution isn't working, do anything else, no matter how strange, to break the pattern.

name: Ear Massage
description: Gently massage the cymba conchae (inner ear) to stimulate the auricular branch of the vagus nerve.

name: Values Sorting
description: Sort a list of values (e.g., Freedom, Intimacy) into "Very Important," "Important," and "Not Important" to prioritize focus.

name: Behavioral Experiments
description: Design a real-world test to verify a belief (e.g., "If I speak up, people will laugh") and record the actual outcome.

name: Clouds in the Sky
description: View thoughts as weather (clouds) and the self as the sky; the sky contains the weather but is not damaged by it.

name: Clean vs. Dirty Discomfort
description: Distinguish between "clean" pain (natural emotion) and "dirty" pain (suffering caused by struggling against the emotion).

name: Grounding
description: Physically connect feet to the floor and describe the physical environment to exit emotional escalation.

name: The Magic Wand Question
description: Ask "If a magic wand took away this pain, what would you be doing with your life?" to identify neglected values.

name: STOP Skill
description: Stop (freeze), Take a step back, Observe the situation, and Proceed mindfully.

name: Values Bullseye
description: Plot current behaviors on a target to see how close they are to the "bullseye" of your core values.

name: The "Worry Chair"
description: Designate a specific chair (not the bed) for worrying; if worries arise in bed, move to the chair.

name: IMPROVE: One Thing in the Moment
description: Focus entire attention on a single task, blocking out the past and future.

name: Relationship Questions
description: Ask "What would your mother/partner/friend say they appreciate about you?" to shift perspective.

name: Tactile Activation
description: Rub arms or legs vigorously to wake up the skin boundaries and return to the body.

name: Physicalizing the Emotion
description: Give an emotion a shape, color, weight, and texture to objectify and accept it.

name: Music Playlist Therapy
description: Create playlists specifically designed to evoke or soothe specific emotional states.

name: Direct Access
description: The therapist talks directly to the part (e.g., "Can I speak to the Anger?") rather than the client talking about the part.

name: Unblending
description: Ask a part to "step back" or "separate" from the Self so it can be observed rather than being the observer.

name: Presupposing Change
description: Ask "What is better since last time?" rather than "Is anything better?", assuming positive change has occurred.

name: Savoring
description: Intentionally prolong the enjoyment of a positive experience (e.g., eating a meal slowly).

name: Pendulation
description: Shift attention back and forth between an area of distress and an area of neutral/resourceful sensation in the body.

name: Urge Surfing
description: Visualize the urge as a wave; watch it rise, peak, and crash without giving in to it.

name: The Tombstone Exercise
description: Write the inscription you would want on your tombstone to distill your life's purpose.

name: Savoring the Exhale
description: Focus specifically on the sensation of the air leaving the body to encourage the "letting go" response.

name: Imaginal Exposure
description: Vividly visualize a feared scenario in the present tense to habituate to the anxiety it provokes.

name: Separating Fact from Opinion
description: Systematically categorize internal dialogue into objective facts (observable data) and subjective opinions (interpretations).

name: Putting Thoughts on Trial
description: Act as a defense attorney and prosecutor for a distressing thought to objectively weigh the evidence before rendering a verdict.

name: Weighted Blanket
description: Use deep pressure stimulation to increase serotonin and decrease cortisol.

name: FAST
description: Be Fair, No Apologies (for having needs), Stick to values, Be Truthful.

name: TIPP: Paired Muscle Relaxation
description: Tense muscle groups while inhaling, and relax them deeply while exhaling.

name: Resonant Breathing
description: Breathe at a rate of roughly 5-6 breaths per minute to synchronize heart rate variability (HRV).

name: The 80th Birthday Speech
description: Imagine what you would want loved ones to say about your character at your 80th birthday to clarify values.

name: Problem-Solving Worksheet
description: Break a problem into specific steps, brainstorm solutions, select one, and plan implementation.

name: Treating Thoughts as Guesses
description: Label predictions about the future as hypotheses rather than facts, requiring data collection to verify.

name: Unique Outcomes
description: Highlight moments that contradict the "problem-saturated" story (e.g., "You stood up for yourself there?").

name: Behavioral Activation
description: Engage in a behavior before feeling the motivation to do so, recognizing that action often precedes emotion.

name: Naming the Story
description: Identify repetitive thought patterns (e.g., "Ah, here is the 'I'm not good enough' story again").

name: Pleasant Activity Scheduling
description: Intentionally schedule simple, high-reward activities to increase positive reinforcement in daily life.

name: Physicalizing the Thought
description: Imagine the thought as an object in front of you; what is its shape, color, and size?.

name: ACCEPTS: Emotions
description: Generate a different emotion by watching a funny movie or listening to upbeat music.

name: IMPROVE: Prayer
description: Open the heart to a supreme being or the universe to ask for strength.

name: The Survey Method
description: Ask trusted friends or colleagues how they would view or handle a specific situation to reality-test assumptions.

name: Body Scanning
description: Systematically sweep attention through the body to identify areas of tension or numbness.

name: The Struggle Switch
description: Visualize anxiety as a switch; when "on," you struggle and amplify it. Turn the switch "off" by dropping the struggle, even if anxiety remains.

name: Externalizing the Critic
description: Visualize the inner critic as a separate character to reduce fusion with its message.

name: Physiological Sigh
description: Two quick inhales through the nose followed by one long exhale through the mouth to offload carbon dioxide and calm the system.

name: Pushing Against the Wall
description: Push hands firmly against a wall to engage muscles and sense boundaries and strength.

name: Alternate Nostril Breathing
description: Breathe in through one nostril, hold, and breathe out through the other to balance the hemispheres.

name: Retrieval/Unburdening
description: Visualize going into the past to retrieve an Exile from a traumatic memory and bringing them to a safe place.

name: Graded Task Assignment
description: Break a large, overwhelming task into micro-steps to overcome procrastination.

name: Circular Questioning
description: Ask A how they think B feels about C's behavior to reveal systemic patterns.

name: GIVE
description: Be Gentle, act Interested, Validate the other, use an Easy manner.

name: Box Breathing
description: Inhale 4, Hold 4, Exhale 4, Hold 4 to regulate the autonomic nervous system.

name: Leaves on a Stream
description: Visualize thoughts as leaves floating down a stream; watch them pass without picking them up.

name: Asking "What are you afraid would happen?"
description: Ask a protective part what it fears would happen if it stopped doing its job.

name: The "I'm Having the Thought That..."
description: Rephrase "I am a failure" to "I am having the thought that I am a failure" to create distance.

name: The Room Technique
description: Visualize a part in a room and view it through a window to establish safe distance.
